io.sphere.sdk.meta

Class ProductSearchDocumentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sphere.sdk.meta.ProductSearchDocumentation

  • public final class ProductSearchDocumentation
extends java.lang.Object
    Products can be retrieved using full-text search, filtering and faceting functionality combined.

    The Query API lets you search things for their field values but does not provide full-text search for multiple fields.

    The search endpoints provide text analysis, full-text search over multiple fields and faceting. They are supposed to be faster than the query endpoints with the price of eventual consistency. So for example if you change a product name it will take some seconds to propagate this change to the search index.

    The following examples are based on the search for products. Notice that the result list does NOT contain elements of the type Product, but elements of the type ProductProjection. As a result the class to create a search request for products is called ProductProjectionSearch and not ProductSearch.

    Full Text Search

    With ProductProjectionSearch you can perform a full-text search for a specific language. The following example searches for products containing the word "shoe" in English.

    final Search<ProductProjection> search = ProductProjectionSearch.of(STAGED).withText(ENGLISH, "shoe");
final PagedSearchResult<ProductProjection> pagedSearchResult = execute(search);

    See the test code.

    On the full text search documentation page you can explore which fields are included for the search.

    Pagination and Sorting

    How pagination works in SPHERE.IO is described in QueryDocumentation.

    Use SearchDsl.withOffset(long), SearchDsl.withLimit(long) and SearchDsl.withSort(io.sphere.sdk.search.SearchSort) for pagination. For example the following request searches all products with a certain sort expression (not shown), skipping the first 50 products and limiting the result set to only 25 products:

    final SearchSort<ProductProjection> sort = getASortExpressionSomeHow();
final Search<ProductProjection> search = ProductProjectionSearch.of(STAGED)
        .withSort(sort)
        .withOffset(50)
        .withLimit(25);

    See the test code.

    On the the sorting documentation page you can explore for which fields you can sort for.

    Filters and Facets

    Filters

    A presentation of filters and facets can be found here.

    There are three types of filters:

    filter query
    This parameter applies a filter to the query results before facets have been calculated. Filter in this scope does influence facet counts. If facets are not used, this scope should be preferred over filter results. Use SearchDsl.withFilterQueries(java.util.List).
    filter results (in HTTP API just "filter")
    This parameter applies a filter to the query results after facets have been calculated. Filter in this scope doesn't influence facet counts. Use SearchDsl.withFilterResults(java.util.List).
    filter facets
    This parameter applies a filter to all facet calculations (but not query results), except for those facets that operate on the exact same field as the filter. This behavior in combination with the filter scope enables multi-select faceting. Use SearchDsl.withFilterFacets(java.util.List).
      filters results filters facets
    filter query yes yes
    filter resultsyes no
    filter facetno yes
    using no filterno no

    Facets

    For faceted search, results can be of TermFacetResult or RangeFacetResult.

    Consult the HTTP API documentation for filters and facets for more information.
